0.user_question: There were 12 people on the bus. At the next stop 4 more people got on the bus. Each bus can not have more than 36 people. How many people are there on the bus now?

ost_step.1: There were initially 12 people on the bus.
ost_step.2: 4 more people got on at the next stop.
ost_step.3: So, there are now 12 + 4 = 16 people on the bus.

direct_answer.text:
You're right! Initially there were 12 people on the bus. When 4 more people boarded at the next stop, you correctly calculated the new count as:

12 (initial people) + 4 (newly boarded people) = 16 people.

So, there are now 16 people on the bus. You don't need to consider the capacity limit since it was merely provided as a hint and doesn't affect this particular calculation based on the given information.

The answer is: 16.
